intro: Impatiens andringitrensis, commonly known as the Andringitra impatiens, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Balsaminaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically come in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and its stems are often hairy as well. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of humid forests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
